main_definition: Appealing in a graceful or attractive way, often with an element of endearment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Attractive and pleasing to the senses
meanings_and_examples.example: The garden was full of charming flowers that smelled delightful.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Able to attract or please others through grace, wit, or elegance
meanings_and_examples.example: She has a charm about her that makes everyone feel at ease and appreciated.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Mildly amusing or endearing in an innocent way
meanings_and_examples.example: The child's charming antics always bring smiles to the faces of adults around him.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Tactful and clever in managing situations or people
meanings_and_examples.example: His charm allowed him to negotiate a favorable deal without causing any conflict.
